snippet: The fight against ISIS is a two-front campaign. We keep making it about us and Obama. But that’s the wrong way to look at it.
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column argues that Pres Obama's offensive against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria can only succeed if unreliable regional partners become serious about achieving compromise and stability in the Middle East; contends that ISIS is a natural consequence of civil wars in Iraq and Syria, and that no lasting peace will come until these crises are resolved.
lead_paragraph: The fight against ISIS is a two-front campaign. We keep making it about us and Obama. But that’s the wrong way to look at it.

headline.seo: Obama’s Strategy for Fighting ISIS Isn’t All About Us

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
